intro: Tabernaemontana amygdalifolia var. obtusiloba, commonly known as the broad-leaved star of Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves and showy, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Its striking appearance and relatively low maintenance make it a favored plant in tropical and subtropical regions.
